content: is there a way to get a generic incoming webhook to work without writing code/config? (sorry if stupid question, just getting started playing with zulip and trying to move our webhooks over)
@realitygaps For most things at zulipchat.com/integrations you shouldn't need to write anything. What product(s) are you trying to integrate?

zammad for example (i dont want to use zapier or ifttt for this). its just a basic {"text":"message"} slack compatible standard sort of webhook id like to get to work (which is implemented in all sorts of software inculding zammad)
@Rishi Gupta like under header 4 of https://api.slack.com/incoming-webhooks
many applications have 'slack' integration which can also be used with many chat systems. but in the end is just an implementation of an endpoint for this very basic webhook
we have been getting items from zammad to matrix in this way (and rocketchat, and some others we tested, so expected it to be simple here too)

got it. I remember talking about doing this at some point, and agreed it's something we should support if we don't currently. May have to wait for someone more familiar with the integrations system to come online
ah ok. well, we maybe manage to figure it out and contribute a 'basic webhook' addon :P
ill take a look later in the week hopefully
thx for your reply @Rishi Gupta
so far i like the software a lot
(we launched an instance to production today)
